snippet: A group of private beach clubs in Throgs Neck holds a swim competition every summer. Participants race against each other, and take on the murky Eastchester Bay.
abstract: Interclub Association, group of private beach clubs in Throgs Neck, Bronx, has been holding swim competition in dirty water of Eastchester Bay every summer for 59 years; swimmers, undeterred by conditions, say water has become somewhat cleaner over decades (Series: Summer In...).
lead_paragraph: A group of private beach clubs in Throgs Neck holds a swim competition every summer. Participants race against each other, and take on the murky Eastchester Bay.

headline.main: For Clubs’ Swimmers, Bronx Water’s Fine, and So Is the Scum
headline.print_headline: For Clubs’ Swimmers, Bronx Water’s Fine, and So Is the Scum
